data.text: @groie Hello!  Certificate should be in English, however we can also accept certificates in French, German, Spanish, Russian, Italian, Estonian or Swedish if you start your Finnair journey from these countries or from a country in which one of these is an official language/Hanna-Mari

Finnair issues a senior unsecured bond of EUR 400 million. “My warmest thanks to everyone who invested in Finnair's new bond. Due to your strong trust in Finnair, we were able to double its size compared to the previous one”, says CFO @MStirkkinen. https://t.co/mSKLA58qrT

Starting today, we accept a coronavirus vaccination certificate when travelling to Finland. We accept a certificate for all vaccines approved by WHO or EMA. You need to have received the vaccination latest 21 days before the travel date. https://t.co/L8txW6uPCe https://t.co/mwtcdpgZRD

data.text: @ben48582498 Hi Ben! We haven't had muffins in our selection recently, but previously we served muffins by Aunt Mabels. /Mari
@Nieusha1 Hi, unfortunately we don't have the teddy bear in our selection anymore. /Mari

Finnair now has more than 100,000 shareholders. The amount of shareholders has almost quadrupled in a little over a year. Finnair is currently the 9th most owned Finnish stock. Warm thanks to our shareholders for their trust in Finnair! https://t.co/eq5WdL30VH https://t.co/PNeNqnlh47

Did you know that the Finnair app now also has Customer Service? You can also book travel extras, check in, see your boarding passes and gate numbers, and access your Finnair Plus card.  Read more and download! https://t.co/byHXicayX1
@quarterbefore1 Hello! Kindly send us a direct message with your booking reference so we can take a look at the situation//Hanna-mari

With the possibility of restrictions easing around the globe, we've gradually started getting our cabin crew and pilots primed for a return to the skies. It's vital to ensure everyone's skills remain at the high level they were before the pandemic. https://t.co/5208zMX0Ws

Finnair in Q1: travel demand remained weak due to travel restrictions, but cargo continued to perform. Our revenue decreased by 79.8% to 113.6 million euros. Gradual recovery of demand is estimated to start from late summer. https://t.co/imuTAI0MT7 https://t.co/SpVKkDi3oD

data.text: We will fly to over 60 destinations in summer 2021 – flights will be added as travel gradually opens. In June, we will resume flights to e.g. Reykjavik, Nice, Vilnius and Los Angeles. https://t.co/pOcoNx7agF https://t.co/1UjWxbN4mF
@lynbelltlaut Hi Lyn, thank you for development idea. Have a great weekend!//Roosa
@thuntalai Hi, the certificate must state the time when you had the virus, which cannot be within 2 weeks of travel.//Roosa

@awomannamedkemi Hi, the certificate must contain your full name (as in your travel document), date of birth, name of the disease vaccinated against (COVID-19), date, time and place of vaccination, the name of the vaccine brand and the party (person and company) issuing the certificate.//Roosa
@thuntalai Hi Chris, if you have had coronavirus and you have doctor's certificate about that then you can travel with that certificate. You can see more information from the link.//Roosa

urls.title: Travelling to Finland
urls.description: Finland has opened for travel from the EU and Schengen countries. Travel from outside of the EU and Schengen area remains restricted. Finnish authorities define the entry requirements to Finland. See more detailed instructions below. Please also note that travel restrictions are subject to change at short notice. As a traveller, you are always responsible for ensuring that you fulfil the requirements of your destination and possible transit country. You can check the current entry restrictions to Finland

data.text: We will accept a Covid-19 vaccination certificate as an alternative to a negative test result or a certificate of a previous infection for travellers to Finland as of May 11. https://t.co/diJSSEzRB8 https://t.co/KMkVJdwtkp

urls.title: Neste and Finnair present Sustainable Aviation Fuel based solution to reduce business travel emissions
urls.description: Neste Corporation, Press Release, 13 April 2021 at 9 a.m. (EET) Neste and Finnair are joining forces to reduce carbon emissions related to Neste employees’ business travel by using Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF). Neste has recently made 300 tons of Neste MY Sustainable Aviation Fuel™ available at Helsinki Airport in Finland for Finnair’s use. By replacing a part of the fossil jet fuel with SAF...

data.text: Finnair starts to fly with #SAF from Helsinki Airport as we are presenting Sustainable Aviation Fuel based solution to reduce business travel emissions with @NesteGlobal Read more: https://t.co/uQznpc6NqJ

@StinaMargaretha Hei Stina, Ivalon lennolla on tarjolla maksutta kahvia, teetä, mehua ja vettä. Tämän linkin kautta löydät kattavasti tietoa, kuinka lennoilla tämän hetkisessä tilanteessa toimitaan https://t.co/6pqg8czrTA //Roosa
@jukkan Hi Jukka, we do not store passwords in plain text. //Roosa
@LooFranklin1 Hi, let's hope it's soon. We have flights to Kuala Lumpur in March, but they are not direct flights. They are flights with stop over and with partner airline. //Roosa
@Gustavo_Garcer Hi Gus, hope that it will be possible soon. Have a great weekend! //Roosa

@6D696B6B6F Hei Mikko, joitakin Finnairin kanta-asiakasjärjestelmän tietoja on valitettavasti ollut mukana tietomurrossa, joka on kohdistunut kumppanilentoyhtiöidemme käyttämään kolmannen osapuolen, SITA:n tietojärjestelmään. //Roosa
@Livesaha Tietovuodossa ei ole vuotanut esimerkiksi salasanoja tai muita oleellisia tietoja, mutta varmuuden vuoksi suosittelemme kuitenkin vaihtamaan salasanat. /Elli
@ramnathtweets Hi, they should be safe, no worries :) Please DM us your membership number, e-mail address and phone number on the account so we can doublecheck the account with you. /Elli

Many people have changed their Finnair Plus password after we told about a data breach. Our servers have occasionally been busy because of this. Password change is a precautionary measure and it's not urgent. The breached data cannot be used to access your Finnair Plus account.

We've received several enquiries about whether it's possible to buy parts of our A319 aircraft that will be recycled in Finland. Dismantling aircraft parts and removing them from aviation usage is strictly regulated. Here's why you can't buy them ➡️ https://t.co/X2wLECKqxP

data.text: @JuhaniJussila1 Maskin saa ottaa pois syömisen ja juomisen aikana rajalliseksi ajaksi, mutta syömistä ei voi pitkittää ja käyttää sitä tekosyynä maskittomuuteen – tällaisessa tilanteessa henkilökuntamme käy huomauttamassa asiasta. Suurin osa asiakkaistamme ymmärtää maskin käytön tarpeellisuuden.

urls.title: Feedback and compensation
urls.description: We are currently experiencing backlog in our customer service. We are sorry for the delay in replying to your feedback. Thank you for your patience! We appreciate your feedback and are here to assist you with your claims and other concerns. Your feedback is valuable to us in developing our services further. For more general topics, please check our frequently asked questions, or get assistance from our chat service at any

data.text: @vaterkant Hi! I am sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience. If you wish to give feedback, you may do it on our website: https://t.co/197I0i5Bjj. -Sara

We are today flying from HEL to KTT in collaboration with Fintraffic ANS to test how much fuel consumption can be decreased when we strive to optimise all parts of the flight. Did you know why an accurate departure time is important for fuel efficiency? https://t.co/FABNIQ1esX

Finnair gets set to recycle its A319 aircraft in Finland. This will be the first commercial airliner ever to be recycled in Finland. The project gives us the opportunity to employ our mechanics during a time when their normal workload has decreased. https://t.co/NQV1zyiv55

data.text: Did you know that airplanes are an unlikely place to catch viruses thanks to super-efficient air ventilation and filtering? HEPA filters remove 99.79% of bacteria and viruses and the air in cabins is completely changed every 3-7 minutes. https://t.co/DNt5DjgQh9
@Hallton4 Hi, One of these tests is enough to get on  board. https://t.co/L8txW6uPCe //Jaana

errors.title: Not Found Error
